intro: Fissistigma cupreonitens, commonly known as the coppery nitrate plant, is a rare member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking copper-colored stems and leaves that range from green to reddish hues. Native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in clusters of two to four. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
